title: Communication Noise Analysis and Improvement Strategies in Educational Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational mathematical concepts and ability to interpret educational materials
context.additional_context: A course for early-career professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to learn identifying and improving mathematical communication errors. Requires experience analyzing diverse digital materials in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.

learning_goals: Accurately classify three or more types of communication noise (e.g., semantic/factual errors) occurring in educational materials
Systematically diagnose errors in mathematics education materials using content analysis techniques and document findings in reports
Apply noise-specific correction strategies to propose improvements that enhance learning effectiveness by 20% or more
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
